website_summaries.verdict: If you are familiar with standard stainless steel cookware, this is a comprehensive set to own. Not recommended for those who seek a nonstick cooking experience. Lids with strainers are nice touches.
pros: Built-in strainers and measuring lines are helpful
Lightweight, but provides even heating with aluminum base
cons: Not a nonstick coating, so food can burn and stick to surface
Lid handles can get very hot

customer_reviews.title: Buy metal utensils and preheat!
customer_reviews.text: The pans are beautiful. They are well balanced and sturdy. If you dont follow the preheating and oil instructions, food will stick. You need metal utensils, too. Plastic will not work well. If food sticks, a breif soak followed by steel wool and powder cleanser cleans them up quickly and good as new. I have had mine a month or so and I use them everyday. Still gorgeous.
customer_reviews.author: Tennery B. McCutcheon

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy stainless steel products but they stain
customer_reviews.text: These are Sturdy , have a thick bottom and easy to clean but they lost their glossy finish and stained after one use .
customer_reviews.author: Rathan

customer_reviews.title: These stainless pots stain.
customer_reviews.text: I am very unhappy with these pots. The first time I used them, they became discolored. I used Brillo but to no avail. I called Calphalon and they told me that stainless steel is not non stick (in other words, stainless stains) which I have never found to be the case in previous brand pots that I have had. They told me to buy Bar Keepers Friend cleanser and gave me additional instructions which I followed. The Bar Keepers helped add a shine but it did not take away the "stains".
customer_reviews.author: Roberta

customer_reviews.title: My food actually tastes better !!
customer_reviews.text: There was a learning curve going from t fal non stick pans to these , if this is your first set of stainless steel pans I highly recommend doing some research and learning how to cook in them , with that being said after a couple burnt chicken breasts and a small amount of frustration this is by far the best pan set I’ve ever owned and my food cooks more evenly along with tasting better ! I’d suggest getting some bar keepers secret cleaner to clean them with so they stay nice and shiney! Was a great buy !!!
customer_reviews.author: brandy jo keith

customer_reviews.title: CHEFS!!  Get these for your house.
customer_reviews.text: I recommend this set of pots and pans to any chef for home use. If you maintain these pots and pans they will last for at least your short life. No warping under high oven heat. Easy to clean even if you use the sauce pan to braise with. Impeccable heat distribution allowing for superior searing. I use these guys on a glass top and they distribute the well enough to seat four chick breasts, 10 scallops, two strips,etc.... I’d use them in my restaurant but let’s get real what am I eleven Madison park lol
customer_reviews.author: Jared martin

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: They cook really well, and they look as advertised. Beautiful silver finish. The biggest issue and I think this is probably the worst overlooked concern. The Lid handle, which is steel as well, heats up with the pot it's covering! It will take your finger tips getting burned before realizing this. For ANY lid that's being used, you have to use an oven mitt to take lid off and on while cooking and stirring. If I could I'd return these pots and buy a different set. Having to wear oven mitts while cooking stove top is horrible to me.
customer_reviews.author: Novico

customer_reviews.title: Go with something else!
customer_reviews.text: I've had these pans just about two months and am looking for new ones already. These are probably one of worst sets of pots and pans I've owned. I have perviously owned T•fal and others from this manufacturer with much success and longevity. But, this line has been horrible. Everything burns (using both gas and electric) they are impossible to clean even when using low heat or only boiling water. If you're looking to buy these pans, my advice would be keep looking! I regret the purchase and imagine I will buy other pans at half the cost, that will be a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT STAIN FREE! NOT RUST FREE! NOT WORTH THE MONEY.
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS WHAT HAPPENS AFTER USING EACH PIECE FOR THE FIRST TIME, 1 TIME! STAINS AND RUST. IT DOESN'T MATTER HOW CAREFUL YOU ARE, THERE'S NO WAY OF ESCAPING THE STAINING AND THE RUST. SO BEWARE!
customer_reviews.author: David Barreto

customer_reviews.title: They clean up so easy it's unbelievable
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I use these every day. Almost a year after buying them he still comments about how much he loves these pans - definitely worth it. They clean up so easy it's unbelievable.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth H.

customer_reviews.title: Love the pans
customer_reviews.text: Love the pans. Alittle hard getting used to them from having nonstick pan . But heat and hold it well. The heat plate on the bottom is great. Cook in low or med ,never higher. Clean great and stay looking good.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth&Timothy Hostetler

customer_reviews.title: Food sticks badly
customer_reviews.text: They’re to pits to clean! Try frying bacon and see what clean up is like also try an egg . It will stick to the pan even when using butter. Don’t buy this product or you’ll be upset like me.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Medeiros

customer_reviews.title: Please read reviews
customer_reviews.text: Product looks great, but everything sticks to the surface. Cook on low to medium and even lightly coat with oil, but sticks every time. Was displaying them in kitchen hanging rack, but now they look like crap. Now they sit in the other brands box (RR) I purchased while I try for warranty. Boy is that fun.
customer_reviews.author: waveman

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using them for awhile, I do like them, definitely buy the cleaner bartender friend cleans them perfect also don’t use high heat works best with low to medium heat. They are really good quality for the price ,I like that they are not to heavy and also the best feature is the lids that strain and the measurement markings.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Sticky and hard to clean.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy. At first excited to have a full matching set of quality pots, I was then disappointed multiple time. Everything stuck, regardless of oil quantity, cleaning always required soaking and deep scrubbing. The bottom fell off the saucepan after prolonged high heat. Have now had to replace multiple pieces. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a brand new glass-topped stove and researched the best pans to use. This set was near the top of the recommendations. I already had the Calphalon frying pan and knew they were top-quality. I would have preferred to have bought them by the piece, but since I am not going into stores due to the pandemic, I ordered the set. They are wonderful! Follow the instructions and use Barkeeper's Friend to clean them and the will last a long, long time, I think.
customer_reviews.author: rtdchemteach

customer_reviews.title: Great pans when used correctly
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a great stainless steel set. You really need to research "how to cook with stainless steel" to appreciate these pans. Your cooking techniques are totally different from non stick pans as non stick is way more forgiving. As for cleaning they do come clean quite easily, some uses require you to use some Bartenders friend to get them totally clean and tarnish free. Edit: after a week or so of making eggs every morning, pan seared scallops, rib eye steak and even soft shell crabs these pans clean up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Broadbent

customer_reviews.title: Not the good of quality
customer_reviews.text: Had these for a year and already food is sticking to the pan, discoloration to the bottom and inside the pots and pans. For the price it was not worth it in my opinion. I follows the proper cleaning directions as well and this still happened. I wont be buying this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Briana

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Lighter than expected which was actually a great ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Lighter than expected which was actually a great thing because having a heavy pot and then adding water makes it very difficult for me to lift. They look and feel great and I can't wait to have this set for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these pots they are nice and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Love these pots they are nice and sturdy. What coating the pot make sure you use oil with a high smoking temp, because I tried olive oil at first and it left a yellow film. But then i switched to avocado oil and it sparkles. and no film
customer_reviews.author: Jlag

customer_reviews.title: Get these you won't regret it!
customer_reviews.text: OH MY GOD! Let me say these are amazing!!! I've had normal black coated cook ware, it sucks we all know this, I've had some of the porcelain coated as well slightly better, however everything sticks to it and it stains. This stuff is AMAZING! Does not scratch, nothing's stuck to it so far and cleaning is soooooo easy! Just spray away cooked on stuff or use brillow pad, again does not scratch! Also I have an electric stove and I always thought it took forever to cook stuff on this stove compared to gas. Turns out these pans heat most evenly and faster! Who knew! Anyway get these you won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria

customer_reviews.title: Good stainless.
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure at first, but after several month's use, I like it a lot. I wish the lid handles didn't get hot but I don't know what one could do about that. Also, I wish it was manufactured in the US rather than in China.
customer_reviews.author: Roger R.

customer_reviews.title: Just relax and go slow
customer_reviews.text: Hey all! This is just my honest review. Please use lower cooking levels regardless of your stove/range. Let the pan sit for 5 minutes or more as it heats up, don’t rush this. Then add whatever you are cooking that rested with at the same time outside of refrigeration. It really works. This is a great cooking set. No need to rush it will cook and brown and be great !!!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Jones

customer_reviews.title: Big Calphalon fan
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pot rack years ago to free up cabinet space and am not at all sorry I did. Subsequently we started collecting attractive cookware since it hangs out in plain sight. Calphalon was available at a shop in an outlet mall I frequented so I accumulated several pieces and am very happy with them. Stainless steep is best for easy cleaning and long life and looks great. The lids slide over the handles and then you hang them. This set was bought as a gift and the recipient really likes them.
customer_reviews.author: DIY and Gadgets

customer_reviews.title: Overall would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set when I moved into my own place, as I needed more cooking utensils. Like some other reviews have mentioned they're definitely not non-stick (even with preheat) and they definitely stain. I bought these a few years ago and over that time I have replaced most of them. I replaced the frying pans with carbon steel, cast iron, and granite ones. I replaced the sauce pan with a non-stick coating pan. I still have the pots. Even with the stains, I really do like the straining feature. The straining feature is the reason I give 2 stars, but overall I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brett C

customer_reviews.title: Burn
customer_reviews.text: These things burn like no other. I’ll never buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey Oliveira

customer_reviews.title: Great product with a very good quality
customer_reviews.text: I’m reviewing after more than two months of use and I can comfortably say it’s one of the best investment we made in our kitchen. Once you receive it, you feel the good quality in it. Very well built and different sizes that fits all our needs. Relatively easy to clean and if you used a towel to dry it up right after washing you will keep the shining look for long. Me and my wife always clean it by hand and not putting it in the dishwasher as recommended. Can’t be more happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amr

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased and looking forward to using!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first set I've bought since 2011, my first Calphalon set and I'm very pleased. These pots are HEAVY and heat very evenly and well in my use. The handles are sturdy and comfortable, the etched marking lines inside are easy to read and seem to be holding up well to wear. It'd be a while since I'd used stainless skillets and I stuck some hash in one quiet badly on day one but even that came out easily with a plastic pot scraper and hot water. The kids fit well, the pots pour well, they heat well and look great. Very pleased so far.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Satyr

customer_reviews.title: Exploding glass lid is dangerous!
customer_reviews.text: Love the look of this set and looked forward to cooking with it. Used it for the first time last night and one of the glass lids spontaneously exploded/shattered! Very loud popping noise and then it shattered. Scary and potentially dangerous! Would never recommend glass lids.
customer_reviews.author: Denise K.

customer_reviews.title: Great set of pots
customer_reviews.text: I love this cookware! The main reason I purchased this set is because the lids have drain holes so all you do is hold the lid and tip the pot so the water drains. They’re easy to clean too.
customer_reviews.author: Thimble1217

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed. I read reviews that not caring for them properly or not following instructions before cooking can cause foods to stick to pan and making cooking with them difficult. I’ve only used them a few times and I followed all the directions including washing them with bar keepers, hand washing them every time, preheating the pans before using them and not rinsing them until they have cooled etc. and everything seems to still stick to them while cooking. I also use coconut oil to coat my pans, not the aerosols the instructions mentioned that shouldn’t be used. What an absolute waste of $200.
customer_reviews.author: Jillayne

customer_reviews.title: TL;DR - Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Save your money and buy something else. This is the first time we used it and it’s basically ready to be tossed into the trash can. Very disappointed. Haven’t used the other ones so i’ll leave two stars for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Catalina Azcarate

customer_reviews.title: These are incredible pans
customer_reviews.text: I got concerned about all of the non-stick coating flaking off of my old pans so I dumped them and went with these. They have a thick bottom so they heat evenly and the heat is well distributed. They are easy to maintain at a simmer or a nice low sauté. If you heat them up and add the appropriate amount of oil before you cook sticking is a minimal problem. They are easy to clean up. Great pans.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Frech

customer_reviews.title: DURABLE, EASY TO CLEAN 👍
customer_reviews.text: A LITTLE BIT EXPENSIVE. MY FIRST SET OF THIS BRAND LASTED 25YRS AND STILL COOKS OK. THEY WERE THE DARK SET NOT STAINLESS STEEL LIKE THIS ONE. I JUST HAVEN'T FOUND A BETTER BRAND AND MOST ARE MADE IN CHINA. 👎 GO AHEAD BUY THEM. THESE LAST A LONG TIME AND YOU'LL BE HAPPY WITH THEM.
customer_reviews.author: R. Conner

customer_reviews.title: Stains on first use, doesn't seem like true stainless steel
customer_reviews.text: Boiled eggs, made rice and cooked bacon, using 3 different pieces... All pans/pots stained really badly on first use I couldn't get it off even though the food shouldn't have left a mark. I only use stainless steel and cast iron... I need a set that will last longer than this will.
customer_reviews.author: Kae

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT STICK OR BURN
customer_reviews.text: I love these pots. They are very easy to clean even if you burn your food lol. They are very good quality. Food really taste better. My daughter burned chicken and a little soap and water it was back to spotless. Did not need any hard scrubbing. A MUST BUY!!!!!! Very good quality. My sister added them to her bride registry ones she saw how they perform. For some reason it makes the food cook faster. That’s 100 truth. I love my pots.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley williams

customer_reviews.title: The handles are nice the pots seem small however.
customer_reviews.text: Overall these seem to be good quality so far. No issues with cleaning them if you are having issues you should watch some videos online about using stainless steel cookware. Really needed a new set and did not want to get teflon again as they always get worn out. only gave 3 stars on value for money because i feel the the pan sizes are too small.
customer_reviews.author: X1trickshow

customer_reviews.title: Its ok
customer_reviews.text: May be I don't know how to use it but unless I constantly stir, food gets stock (on a small flame too).
customer_reviews.author: eli freydlin

customer_reviews.title: I see your reflection in this dish water.
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for a little over a month now. Picked these after deciding to get away from coated pots and pans. They take a little getting used to: Have had to adjust cooking temperatures because of better heat distribution, they work well in a dish washer, but you are going to have to scrub. Stay on top of it.
customer_reviews.author: A-zon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Food sticks, difficult to clean
customer_reviews.text: I don’t recommend these pans at all, everything sticks to them and are very difficult to clean. This was very disappointing because we have an older pan from the same brand and style and that one is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Stone

customer_reviews.title: Very nice cookware!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this set. Everything is high quality and looks fantastic. The handles do not get hot, as some reviewers stated, unless you put the pans in the oven. They seem to heat very evenly, and are easy to clean up. I expect this cook set to last a very, very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Nice and heavy
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice easy to clean with beekeeper friend, if you season it well it wont stick anymore. It comes with cup measurements inside the pots and it's got a lip on the edges so if you put the lid on you can hold the food back while you pour the liquid
customer_reviews.author: mike deegan

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality, but not for every one
customer_reviews.text: The pots are heavy, sturdy and good. If you are not used to cooking with stainless steel utensil, then you might avoid it or get used to it as everything Sticks and pot becomes dark, you have to stirr it continuously. The cleaning is also not pleasant after the pot burns. Overall the product is great, has what is told.
customer_reviews.author: ms2562

customer_reviews.title: Great set of pans that won’t break the bank.
customer_reviews.text: These pans have been great. The price is reasonable and they have been put to the test in our kitchen. Clean up easily on a regular basis, Bar Keepers Friend works wonders here and there. We have used ours on an induction burner, our gas stove, and in the oven. No problems. Happy with our pans. They stack nicely in the pan drawer too!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer W. Gorman

customer_reviews.title: Bottom tarnished after only one use
customer_reviews.text: The flat bottom pan is severely tarnished after only one use. No matter how hard I tried to clean it, it still looks 'dirty' and tarnished.
customer_reviews.author: Lyra

customer_reviews.title: Hot handles, scorched surfaces
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to keep my family safe by buying cookware without harmful coatings, but we’ve collectively burnt our hands on lids and handles enough to rethink my plan. This was not the set for our family. Unfortunately I didn’t cook with it enough to realize my mistake until I missed the return date, so I’m stuck with them for now.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Ditta

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I love these pots and pans. They are beautiful and clean up nicely. I didn't think we needed new pots but when my husband bought these I was pleasantly surprised with what a difference there was when I cooked with them. Amazing
customer_reviews.author: Christopher I.

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't be happier with this set
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cookware set based on reviews. We needed to replace all of our stainless steel cookware because we got an induction stove. I couldn't be happier with this set. I've never used non-stick and those that complain about these not being non-stick just aren't used to them I use Barkeepers Friend (have been using it for years) just to keep the cookware looking like new.
customer_reviews.author: Michele A. Marino

customer_reviews.title: don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: These pans are horrible. EVERYTHING sticks to these pans no matter how much butter or oil I use. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela PNW

customer_reviews.title: Not stainless
customer_reviews.text: Colander design on these is great, handles don’t overheat, should be a great pan, but they aren’t stainless! After their first use nearly every pan in the set has markings. The frying pan just had some ground beef cooked in it with plenty of oil and developed those stains, and the pot had pasta boiled and got those dark brown marks. Really disappointing and not high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Pans and Pots looking nice
customer_reviews.text: The set is very good looking. All Quart pots and Sauce pans are pretty good to use and easy to clean. After cooking and cleaning, if inside the pan and pots have white marks, can get off by adding vinegar into boil, when water is boiling add 2 teaspoons of baking soda. Pans and pots will look good again. I was a bit disappointed at the Flying pan both 8" and 10" not sure why they turn color after 1st use, and flying egg sticks. I couldn't make a nice shape of eggs out of these pans. Even the flying pans didn't work out for me, but I like all the other ones. So I decided to keep them.
customer_reviews.author: Qin Jane Wang

customer_reviews.title: Pots of Probelms
customer_reviews.text: I jusy recently was able to use my pots after 1. 5 month of dealing woth movers. Boy oh boy was I disappointed, I used the pot above to make a quick sausage and peppers meal. The turkey sausage started to stick immediately and fell apart while I was using my tongs to flip them. I had the use my silicone spatula to turn. Then I put in dishwasher (Cadcade Platinum) and the bottom looks like. I did a manual wash and this is still the result. Such a mistake and a waste.
customer_reviews.author: SOTA

customer_reviews.title: it is not a mirror like finish. They clean up very well
customer_reviews.text: I am really enjoying this set of cookware. As I had stainless before, it was not hard to get use to. The balance of this set suits me well and it is everything I was hoping for. While it does has a shiny finish, it is not a mirror like finish. They clean up very well, I have not had any issues with the clean up.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hylton

customer_reviews.title: SUX!
customer_reviews.text: What else can be said of VERY POOR QUALITY Chinese cookware? It discolors and pits, even just from boiling water - what a joke this stuff has proven to be!
customer_reviews.author: BluenApril

customer_reviews.title: Love these pans!
customer_reviews.text: I am an avid cook. I have been cooking for some 40 years. My first set of pants was given to me by my parents for my wedding 44 years ago. They were copper bottom didn’t I love those pans. Eventually I had to get new PMs I have been struggling for many years to find pants that I like. These pants are wonderful! I absolutely love them. One of the features that I really like is that you can drain some thing right from the pan and not have to bother with a strainer.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia P.

customer_reviews.title: Too small to cook a meal
customer_reviews.text: The pots are munchkin sized and too small to cook a meal for a family. Also, the lids don't fit on the saucepans tightly enough to cook anything that requires a covered pot.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Rondon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: Best set of pots and pans I’ve ever owned! They clean easily with a little Bar Keepers Friend, and make cooking easy. It took a few weeks of practice to get used to how they cook food (easy to burn at first), but now I swear I can cook the best grilled cheese sandwich.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Kibbey

customer_reviews.title: ouch
customer_reviews.text: I really like Calphalon but this particular set is worthless. You will burn you hands when you grab the handle every time; very thin and very poor quality. This is a very cheap version of their normally solid construction.
customer_reviews.author: Emily L Mikkelson

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: The pictures do not do this set justice. They are absolutely gorgeous. The tri-ply is definitely apparent when cooking. Very even heating. They are stainless so cleaning is always a little more of a chore, but well worth it for a nice stainless set at an outstanding price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Nye

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy. Everything get stuck on it.
customer_reviews.text: The worst cookware set that we ever bought. We send it back in less that 3 days and there were even two pots that we never remove sticky food from it. Everything get stuck like if you are buying the cheapest cookware in the world.
customer_reviews.author: Quiñones

customer_reviews.title: Great cookware!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried about the reviews that they’re hard to clean or if you burn stuff they’re ruined, however I have had min for a month, and I LOVE them! They’re perfect, I have had no difficulty cleaning them. I got did burn eggs once and boiled water with a little dish soap and it wiped away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my so-called ceramic skillets with these skills and pans. The heat distribution is excellent. I had to re-learn how to cook on stainless steel without having the food stick. The key is low and slow. I use ghee instead of butter and get great results, but butter, olive oil or veggie oil works well too.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Livers

customer_reviews.title: Pretty before use
customer_reviews.text: This set is beautiful! Very sturdy and heats well; however, the small frying pan is messed up after the first use. Looks like the metal rusted, or is discolored! I used it exactly how the instructions said and I can’t get the ugly discoloring to go away now. I’ve tried bar keepers friend, I’ve tried soaking overnight, nothing takes it away. VERY disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Allyson

customer_reviews.title: Great Pans (If you buy these, know how to use them)
customer_reviews.text: I used these type of pans for years in the restaurant industry and still love them because I don't have to worry about the pan coating chipping (since there isn't one). With that said you should know how to use pans like these to use them properly, otherwise yes everything will stick (saw complaints in other reviews). If you want non stick pans buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Momma Hauber

customer_reviews.title: Nice set
customer_reviews.text: Love these pots and pans. Solid with a good weight to them. Not terrible to clean but not as easy as nonstick pans. Heat evenly and seem to be pretty sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: susan marazzi

customer_reviews.title: Cooking made easier
customer_reviews.text: Using the product every day. Cooks both on the stovetop and in the oven without worrying about heat requirements (it is stainless steel after all). The best thing about the pots/pans is the east of clean up, dishwasher safe and food is easy to scrape off without fear of removing any coating (there is none). Stores easily on shelves. Since there is no colored surface there isn't anything to wear off either.
customer_reviews.author: katmatu

customer_reviews.title: Not Made in America
customer_reviews.text: Some how I missed reading that this product is not made in Toledo, OH any more, but made in China. Yes, I kept it since I had opened everything and washed them. And then I read the bottom of the box and found my error. Bummed!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: These are non-stick pans....
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful cookware that would be best served hanging from your kitchen ceiling. They are non-stick so cooking scrambled eggs is a 5 minute scrubbing mission after cooking them. They also lose their brilliance after cooking once. I do love the lids which can double as vents or strainers and the measuring levels inside the pots are nice. Also, they heat is distributed beautifully. But overall, I regret buying these. TOO MUCH WORK TO KEEP CLEAN.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Horne

customer_reviews.title: Could be better!
customer_reviews.text: I have a love, hate relationship with the product. The things I love about the pans are it cooks all food equally, the pans heat up faster than my 40$ set from Walmart. The things I hate. When cooking eggs in the frying pan, no matter how much oil or butter is used, the egg just sticks to the bottom, then once the egg is out of the pan there is a burnt messy film on it. Clean up is fine only if you have he time to let your pan soak. When the pan is soaked the mess just wiped off.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Good pans for the money. They would be perfect if the handles didn't get hot, but that's easily remedied with hot pads
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I don't love about these pans is that the handles get very hot. I should've assumed as much with the metal handles, but otherwise I've enjoyed these pans with the cup measurements inside the pan and the straining holes that make using a colander unnecessary. All-in-all, I would buy again and recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gvine

customer_reviews.title: She's had two sets of nice non-stick pans in the 13 years we've been married
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my wife. She's had two sets of nice non-stick pans in the 13 years we've been married. She's never been happier and dinner's never been better! These clean up really well and cook evenly. Definitely recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Excellent deal on a Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: Nice solid, heavy duty pots n pans. No strainers needed with the strain lids. They're pretty easy to clean for non-stick.
customer_reviews.author: Bretter

customer_reviews.title: Had to relearn a little from nonstick but work decent.
customer_reviews.text: Work well, sometimes it's hard to clean and needs a small relearn of cooking. Found bar keepers friend does wonders. Like the purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: David Y.

customer_reviews.title: Average
customer_reviews.text: This is an average set nothing to get excited about.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a gift, but as far as I know, the recipients love them.
customer_reviews.author: Martha Connolly

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Cookware
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful pot and pan set. Way better than that falling apart and dangerous non-stick.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Side walls are thin
customer_reviews.text: The side walls of the pots and pans are thin allowing too much heat to reach the contents and therefore what is in the pot/pan to easily burn where it contacts the side walls.
customer_reviews.author: David Howarth

customer_reviews.title: quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought as gift for my daughter. They were pretty good pans. not as good as My Better Homes & Garden pans
customer_reviews.author: Lyle F.

customer_reviews.title: fantastic cook wares
customer_reviews.text: The stainless construction is high quality and sturdy. It is also easy to clean without the worry on scratches. These cook wares have even heat distribution making the cooking results fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Nice kitchen set.
customer_reviews.text: Seem to be a good weight and durable. Like them so far.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte C.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: If you like your food stuck to the pan then this is a product for you!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Gill

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Should of listened to the reviews. Stains easily and food sticks and is very hard to remove.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Sadly disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited about these pans but have been very disappointed. They don't clean well and easily stain and scratch.
customer_reviews.author: P. Seven

customer_reviews.title: Handles get HOT!
customer_reviews.text: The handles get super hot and I have to use an oven mitt to lift the pots and lids everytime I boil water in one of the pots or use a pan for a long period of time. Super dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Madeleine French

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These pots and pans are beautiful and cook great. Love the built in strainers on the pot lids
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent set of pans for the money
customer_reviews.text: Decent pans for the money, I would recommend them. Came from a high price set of nonstick so I do see a weight difference which I miss. Only real complaint is the handles on the small pan and pot are very short, feels odd and keeps your hands close to the heat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great set, stores nicely
customer_reviews.text: Love these pots and pans The lids have built in strainers. I have induction cooktop and they work great with it. Just hard to clean if you are used to having coated cookware.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Bureau

customer_reviews.title: Great pans!
customer_reviews.text: I think these pans are fantastic! They are not non-stick so you do have to adjust your method in order prevent major stickage but they mostly stick free. I would buy these again and recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use
customer_reviews.text: I was initially skeptical to buy these seeing the bad reviews. But it was totally worth to buy these. They are very simple to use, easy to clean - a little heavy maybe sometimes. But overall, I just love these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lids are worthless.
customer_reviews.text: The lids fit so poorly that you cannot cook grains, not even rice, in these pots. Not for serious cooks. Otherwise they seem of decent quality. Nice heavy bottoms etc. It’s a shame that the “pour spout” design means that no other lid will fit either.
customer_reviews.author: sweetypie978

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: I was excited for my new set of Calphalon pot and pans and I was so disappointed to see a used pot inside the new set. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Karma Karma

customer_reviews.title: Not good for cooking eggs
customer_reviews.text: These pots and pans look beautiful, and I like the built in measuring cups, but they are not non-stock. Even if you coat the pan with butter, when cooking eggs it sticks like crazy. My other stainless steel pans do not do this and they were not as expensive!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: These are great and I don’t know why everyone doesn’t have a set!!
customer_reviews.author: Becky Poole

customer_reviews.title: Scratches
customer_reviews.text: Bottom of pans scratched up when took out of box
customer_reviews.author: Chris kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Hard to clean. Expensive.
customer_reviews.text: Everything gets stuck to them, even if you grease them before hand. Very difficult to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Rosana L.

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I got a deal but still sent them back Had to use bar keepers every time, went back to ceramic
customer_reviews.author: Walt Jones

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and wife loves them
customer_reviews.text: Great pans can heat can heat before use, cleans easy with bar keepers friend
customer_reviews.author: michael a krokowski

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Love these pots!! They are just not as easy to clean as the non-stock ones I’m used to. Comes with the territory with stainless steel, though.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica P.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I particularly appreciate the volume markings inside the sauce pans. I also like the clear lids with ventilation holes (which can be also used to drain fluid).
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy R. Rosenberg

customer_reviews.title: Set is not stackable for storage!
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with the quality of the set. I wish the set had included the larger saucepan. I decided to purchase that pan separately. My unfavorable thought regarding these particular pans is the lids are not stackable. The set that is stackable is hundreds of dollars more. Not worth it in my book!
customer_reviews.author: L N.

customer_reviews.title: Not made in America!
customer_reviews.text: Looked at their website and hoping to find something made in the USA and there not! Being a member of a union I believe in buying made in America. Even if it’s a few dollars more!
customer_reviews.author: james

product_meta.title: Calphalon Classic Pots And Pans Set, 10-Piece Cookware Set, Stainless Steel
product_meta.description:
Size:10-Piece| Style Name:SetBuilt to last with time saving features, the Calphalon Classic Stainless Steel 10 pc. Cookware set features etched fill lines that make measuring easy, and covers with straining holes that line up with pour spouts to drain liquids so you don't have to use a separate colander. The pots and pans are made from brushed stainless steel with impact bonded aluminum bases for fast, even heating, and are dishwasher safe for easy cleanup. The 10 pc. set includes a great selection of pans that exel at everything from cooking eggs to searing steaks. Set includes: 8" Frying pan, 10" Frying pan, 1.5QT Sauce pan with cover, 2.5QT Sauce pan with cover, 3QT Sauté pan with cover, 6QT Stock Pot with cover.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Set includes 8-inch Fry Pan, 10-inch Fry Pan, 1 1/2-quart Sauce Pan and Cover, 2 1/2-quart Sauce Pan and Cover, 3-quart Sauté Pan and Cover , and 6-quart Stock Pot and Cover.
feature_bullets: Impact bonded aluminum bases provide fast, even heating; Safe for the stove, oven, broiler, and dishwasher
Long, ergonomic handles provide a secure grip even with full, heavy pans, stay cool even when pan is hot, and are double riveted by hand
Fill lines make measuring easy, and covers have straining holes that line up with pour spouts to drain liquids without having to use a separate colander
Calphalon stainless steel cookware set includes 8 inch Fry Pan, 10 inch Fry Pan, 1.5 qt; Sauce Pan with cover, 2.5 qt; Sauce Pan with cover, 3 qt; Saute Pan with cover, and 6 qt; Stock Pot with cover
